author: Patricia Kowsmann
title: EU to Force Banks to Set Aside More Capital to Tackle Bad Loans
text:
FRANKFURT—The European Union’s executive arm on Wednesday unveiled a proposal that will force the region’s banks to set aside more capital to deal with new loans that turn sour.
Bad debt ballooned in Europe during the financial crisis as households and companies lost the ability to repay loans that accumulated during the boom years. While outstanding bad debt is falling amid the continent’s economic recovery, banks that continue to struggle to turn profitable have been slow to take losses on those loans.
